results.title: Tutorial: Deploy GitLab repositories on Azure Static Web Apps
results.description: Use GitLab with Azure Static Web Apps

descriptions.content: Create a new file named .gitlab-ci.yml at the root of the repository.
No Framework Angular Blazor React Vue The following configuration properties are used in the .gitlab-ci.yml file to configure your static web app.

results.title: CI/CD workflow options in Fabric - Microsoft Fabric
results.description: Learn about different options for building and using deployment pipelines based on customer experiences.

descriptions.content: This article focuses more on the continuous deployment (CD) of the CI/CD process.
Summary This article summarizes the main CI/CD options for a team who wants to build an automated CI/CD process in Fabric.

results.title: Service principals for CI/CD - Azure Databricks
results.description: Learn how to use service principals with CI/CD for Azure Databricks projects.

descriptions.content: Set up GitLab CI/CD GitLab CI/CD must be able to access your Azure Databricks workspace.
To add these custom variables to your GitLab CI/CD project, see Add a CI/CD variable to a project in the GitLab CI/CD documentation.
